"""
Synapse PySpark Data Sanitization Pipeline
Reads from deduplicated delta lake table and saves sanitized data to blob storage
"""

from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from pyspark.sql.functions import *
from pyspark.sql.types import *
from pyspark.sql.window import Window
from notebookutils import mssparkutils
import logging
from datetime import datetime
import time

# Configure logging
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO, format='%(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s')
logger = logging.getLogger()

# Initialize Spark session with Delta Lake support
spark = SparkSession.builder \
    .appName("Data Sanitization Pipeline") \
    .config("spark.sql.extensions", "io.delta.sql.DeltaSparkSessionExtension") \
    .config("spark.sql.catalog.spark_catalog", "org.apache.spark.sql.delta.catalog.DeltaCatalog") \
    .getOrCreate()

# Configuration
STORAGE_ACCOUNT = "baubaisadfsaprod"  # Update with your storage account
INPUT_DELTA_PATH = f"abfss://dl-juror-eric-voters-temp@{STORAGE_ACCOUNT}.dfs.core.windows.net/voters_deduplicated_delta"
OUTPUT_BLOB_PATH = f"abfss://juror-etl@{STORAGE_ACCOUNT}.dfs.core.windows.net/sanitized_export"

# Define final column order for PostgreSQL
FINAL_COLUMNS = [
    "part_no", "register_lett", "poll_number", "new_marker", "title",
    "lname", "fname", "dob", "flags", "address", "address2", "address3",
    "address4", "address5", "address6", "zip", "date_selected1",
    "date_selected2", "date_selected3", "rec_num", "perm_disqual",
    "source_id", "postcode_start", "creation_date", "hash_id"
]

def careful_clean_text_fields(df):
    """
    Carefully clean text fields without destroying valid data
    """
    logger.info("Starting careful text field cleaning")
    
    # Define text columns to clean
    text_columns = ["part_no", "register_lett", "new_marker", "title", "lname", "fname", 
                    "flags", "address", "address2", "address3", "address4", "address5", 
                    "address6", "zip", "perm_disqual", "source_id", "postcode_start", "creation_date"]
    
    for col_name in text_columns:
        if col_name in df.columns:
            df = df.withColumn(col_name,
                when(
                    (col(col_name).isNull()) |
                    (upper(trim(col(col_name))) == "NAN") |
                    (upper(trim(col(col_name))) == "NULL") |
                    (upper(trim(col(col_name))) == "NONE") |
                    (trim(col(col_name)) == ""),
                    lit(None)
                ).otherwise(trim(col(col_name)))
            )
    
    logger.info("‚úÖ Completed careful text field cleaning")
    return df

def clean_and_convert_dob(df):
    """
    Clean and convert DOB field to proper date format
    """
    logger.info("Starting DOB cleaning and conversion")
    
    if 'dob' not in df.columns:
        logger.warning("DOB column not found")
        return df
    
    # Convert DOB to proper date format, handling various input formats
    df = df.withColumn("dob",
        when(
            (col("dob").isNull()) |
            (trim(col("dob")) == "") |
            (upper(trim(col("dob"))).isin(["NULL", "NAN", "NA", "NONE"])),
            lit(None)
        ).otherwise(
            # Try multiple date formats
            coalesce(
                to_date(col("dob"), "dd/MM/yyyy"),    # DD/MM/YYYY
                to_date(col("dob"), "yyyy-MM-dd"),    # YYYY-MM-DD
                to_date(col("dob"), "MM/dd/yyyy"),    # MM/DD/YYYY
                to_date(col("dob"), "dd-MM-yyyy"),    # DD-MM-YYYY
                to_date(col("dob"), "yyyy/MM/dd")     # YYYY/MM/DD
            )
        )
    )
    
    # Count valid dates
    valid_dates = df.filter(col("dob").isNotNull()).count()
    logger.info(f"Valid DOB dates after conversion: {valid_dates:,}")
    
    return df

def clean_register_lett_and_poll_number(df):
    """
    Clean register_lett and poll_number fields with proper truncation
    """
    logger.info("Cleaning register_lett and poll_number fields")
    
    # Clean register_lett: strip whitespace and truncate to 5 chars
    if "register_lett" in df.columns:
        df = df.withColumn("register_lett",
            when(col("register_lett").isNull(), lit(None))
            .otherwise(substring(trim(col("register_lett").cast("string")), 1, 5))
        )
        logger.info("‚úÖ Cleaned register_lett: stripped and truncated to 5 characters")
    
    # Clean poll_number: remove .0 from floats, ensure numeric, truncate to 5 chars
    if "poll_number" in df.columns:
        df = df.withColumn("poll_number_temp",
            # First convert to string and remove .0 suffix if present
            regexp_replace(col("poll_number").cast("string"), "\\.0$", "")
        ).withColumn("poll_number_numeric",
            # Convert to numeric, coercing errors to null
            col("poll_number_temp").cast("double")
        ).withColumn("poll_number",
            # Convert back to string and truncate to 5 chars
            when(col("poll_number_numeric").isNull(), lit(None))
            .otherwise(substring(col("poll_number_numeric").cast("int").cast("string"), 1, 5))
        ).drop("poll_number_temp", "poll_number_numeric")
        
        logger.info("‚úÖ Cleaned poll_number: removed .0 suffix, ensured numeric, truncated to 5 characters")
    
    return df

def truncate_name_fields(df):
    """
    Truncate name fields to 20 characters and validate
    """
    logger.info("Truncating and validating name fields")
    
    for col_name in ["lname", "fname"]:
        if col_name in df.columns:
            initial_count = df.count()
            
            # Remove rows where names are null or invalid
            df = df.filter(
                (col(col_name).isNotNull()) &
                (trim(col(col_name)) != "") &
                (~upper(trim(col(col_name))).isin(["NULL", "NA", "NAN", "NONE"]))
            )
            
            removed = initial_count - df.count()
            if removed > 0:
                logger.info(f"Removed {removed:,} rows with invalid {col_name}")
            
            # Check for names longer than 20 characters and truncate
            long_names_count = df.filter(length(col(col_name)) > 20).count()
            if long_names_count > 0:
                logger.info(f"Truncating {long_names_count:,} {col_name} values > 20 chars")
                df = df.withColumn(col_name, 
                    when(length(col(col_name)) > 20, 
                         substring(col(col_name), 1, 20)
                    ).otherwise(col(col_name))
                )
            
            logger.info(f"‚úÖ {col_name} cleaning complete")
    
    return df

def truncate_address_fields(df):
    """
    Truncate address fields to 35 characters
    """
    logger.info("Truncating address fields to 35 characters")
    
    address_fields = ["address", "address2", "address3", "address4", "address5", "address6"]
    
    for col_name in address_fields:
        if col_name in df.columns:
            # Truncate to 35 chars and clean empty strings
            df = df.withColumn(col_name,
                when(
                    (col(col_name).isNull()) |
                    (trim(col(col_name)) == "") |
                    (upper(trim(col(col_name))).isin(["NULL", "NA", "NAN", "NONE"])),
                    lit(None)
                ).otherwise(
                    substring(trim(col(col_name)), 1, 35)
                )
            )
    
    logger.info("‚úÖ All address fields truncated to 35 chars")
    return df

def clean_address4_special_cases(df):
    """
    Handle special address4 cleaning cases
    """
    logger.info("Handling address4 special cleaning cases")
    
    if "address4" in df.columns and "zip" in df.columns:
        # Remove address4 values that match zip without spaces
        df = df.withColumn("address4",
            when(
                col("address4") == regexp_replace(col("zip"), " ", ""),
                lit(None)
            ).otherwise(col("address4"))
        )
        
        # Remove explicit "NAN" values
        df = df.withColumn("address4",
            when(upper(trim(col("address4"))) == "NAN", lit(None))
            .otherwise(col("address4"))
        )
    
    return df

def fix_address4_null_values(df):
    """
    Fix null address4 values by shifting from other address fields or setting to UNKNOWN
    """
    logger.info("Fixing null address4 values")
    
    if "address4" not in df.columns:
        df = df.withColumn("address4", lit(None).cast("string"))
    
    # Shift address3 to address4 if address4 is null
    if "address3" in df.columns:
        df = df.withColumn("address4",
            when(
                (col("address4").isNull()) & 
                (col("address3").isNotNull()) &
                (trim(col("address3")) != ""),
                col("address3")
            ).otherwise(col("address4"))
        ).withColumn("address3",
            when(
                (col("address4") == col("address3")) & 
                (col("address4").isNotNull()),
                lit(None)
            ).otherwise(col("address3"))
        )
    
    # Shift address2 to address4 if still null and address2 doesn't start with number
    if "address2" in df.columns:
        df = df.withColumn("address4",
            when(
                (col("address4").isNull()) & 
                (col("address2").isNotNull()) &
                (trim(col("address2")) != "") &
                (~col("address2").rlike("^[0-9].*")),  # doesn't start with number
                col("address2")
            ).otherwise(col("address4"))
        ).withColumn("address2",
            when(
                (col("address4") == col("address2")) & 
                (col("address4").isNotNull()),
                lit(None)
            ).otherwise(col("address2"))
        )
    
    # If address4 is still null, try address5 or address6
    for addr_col in ["address5", "address6"]:
        if addr_col in df.columns:
            df = df.withColumn("address4",
                when(
                    (col("address4").isNull()) & 
                    (col(addr_col).isNotNull()) &
                    (trim(col(addr_col)) != ""),
                    col(addr_col)
                ).otherwise(col("address4"))
            )
    
    # Set any remaining nulls to "UNKNOWN"
    remaining_nulls = df.filter(col("address4").isNull()).count()
    if remaining_nulls > 0:
        logger.info(f"Setting {remaining_nulls:,} remaining NULL address4 values to 'UNKNOWN'")
        df = df.withColumn("address4",
            when(col("address4").isNull(), lit("UNKNOWN"))
            .otherwise(col("address4"))
        )
    
    return df

def clean_hash_id_and_deduplicate(df):
    """
    Clean hash_id column and handle deduplication
    """
    logger.info("Cleaning hash_id and handling deduplication")
    
    if "hash_id" not in df.columns:
        logger.error("hash_id column not found in DataFrame")
        return df
    
    initial_count = df.count()
    logger.info(f"Initial row count: {initial_count:,}")
    
    # Clean hash_id values - handle scientific notation and invalid values
    df = df.withColumn("hash_id_clean",
        when(
            (col("hash_id").isNull()) |
            (upper(trim(col("hash_id").cast("string"))).isin(["", "NAN", "NULL", "NONE"])),
            lit(None)
        ).otherwise(
            # Try to convert scientific notation to bigint
            when(
                col("hash_id").cast("string").rlike(".*[eE].*"),
                col("hash_id").cast("double").cast("bigint")
            ).otherwise(
                col("hash_id").cast("bigint")
            )
        )
    ).drop("hash_id").withColumnRenamed("hash_id_clean", "hash_id")
    
    # Remove rows with null hash_id
    df = df.filter(col("hash_id").isNotNull())
    
    after_null_removal = df.count()
    logger.info(f"Records after null hash_id removal: {after_null_removal:,}")
    
    # Check for and handle duplicates
    duplicate_count = df.count() - df.select("hash_id").distinct().count()
    
    if duplicate_count > 0:
        logger.info(f"Found {duplicate_count:,} duplicate hash_id values - removing duplicates")
        
        # Keep only the first occurrence of each hash_id
        window_spec = Window.partitionBy("hash_id").orderBy(col("hash_id"))
        df = df.withColumn("row_num", row_number().over(window_spec)) \
               .filter(col("row_num") == 1) \
               .drop("row_num")
        
        final_count = df.count()
        logger.info(f"Records after deduplication: {final_count:,}")
    
    # Verify uniqueness
    unique_hash_ids = df.select("hash_id").distinct().count()
    total_records = df.count()
    
    if unique_hash_ids == total_records:
        logger.info("‚úÖ Hash_id uniqueness verified")
    else:
        logger.warning(f"‚ö†Ô∏è Hash_id uniqueness issue: {total_records} total vs {unique_hash_ids} unique")
    
    return df

def add_missing_columns_and_reorder(df):
    """
    Add missing columns and reorder according to final schema
    """
    logger.info("Adding missing columns and reordering")
    
    # Add missing columns
    for col_name in FINAL_COLUMNS:
        if col_name not in df.columns:
            if col_name == 'postcode_start':
                df = df.withColumn(col_name, lit(None).cast("string"))  # Explicitly set postcode_start to NULL
            elif col_name == 'part_no':
                df = df.withColumn(col_name, lit(None).cast("string"))  # part_no will be generated by PostgreSQL
            else:
                df = df.withColumn(col_name, lit(None).cast("string"))
            logger.info(f"Added missing column: {col_name}")
    
    # Reorder columns
    df = df.select(*FINAL_COLUMNS)
    
    return df

def final_data_validation(df):
    """
    Perform final data validation before export
    """
    logger.info("Performing final data validation")
    
    # Check critical fields
    critical_fields = ['lname', 'fname', 'address', 'hash_id']
    critical_issues = []
    
    for field in critical_fields:
        if field in df.columns:
            null_count = df.filter(col(field).isNull()).count()
            if null_count > 0:
                critical_issues.append(f"{field}: {null_count:,} NULLs")
    
    if critical_issues:
        logger.warning(f"‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL FIELD ISSUES:")
        for issue in critical_issues:
            logger.warning(f"   - {issue}")
        
        # Remove records with null critical fields
        df = df.filter(
            col("lname").isNotNull() &
            col("fname").isNotNull() &
            col("address").isNotNull() &
            col("hash_id").isNotNull()
        )
        
        final_count = df.count()
        logger.info(f"Records after removing critical nulls: {final_count:,}")
    else:
        logger.info("‚úÖ All critical fields validated successfully")
    
    # Log final statistics
    logger.info(f"Final DataFrame shape: ({df.count()}, {len(df.columns)})")
    
    # Check address4 - should have no nulls
    address4_nulls = df.filter(col("address4").isNull()).count()
    if address4_nulls > 0:
        logger.warning(f"‚ö†Ô∏è {address4_nulls} records still have null address4")
    else:
        logger.info("‚úÖ All records have valid address4")
    
    return df

def export_to_blob_storage(df, output_path, chunk_size=250000):
    """
    Export DataFrame to blob storage in chunks with proper PostgreSQL formatting
    """
    logger.info(f"Exporting data to blob storage: {output_path}")
    
    # Ensure output directory exists
    try:
        if not mssparkutils.fs.exists(output_path):
            mssparkutils.fs.mkdirs(output_path)
            logger.info(f"Created output directory: {output_path}")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.warning(f"Could not create directory (may already exist): {e}")
    
    total_records = df.count()
    logger.info(f"Total records to export: {total_records:,}")
    
    if total_records == 0:
        logger.error("No records to export")
        return None
    
    # Format date columns for PostgreSQL (YYYY-MM-DD)
    datetime_columns = ['dob', 'date_selected1', 'date_selected2', 'date_selected3']
    
    for col_name in datetime_columns:
        if col_name in df.columns:
            df = df.withColumn(col_name,
                when(col(col_name).isNull(), lit(None))
                .otherwise(date_format(col(col_name), "yyyy-MM-dd"))
            )
    
    # Calculate number of chunks
    num_chunks = (total_records + chunk_size - 1) // chunk_size
    logger.info(f"Will create {num_chunks} chunks of approximately {chunk_size:,} records each")
    
    # Export in chunks
    timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
    
    for i in range(num_chunks):
        start_idx = i * chunk_size
        end_idx = min((i + 1) * chunk_size, total_records)
        
        # Create chunk using row_number window function
        window_spec = Window.orderBy(col("hash_id"))
        df_with_row_num = df.withColumn("row_num", row_number().over(window_spec))
        
        chunk_df = df_with_row_num.filter(
            (col("row_num") >= start_idx + 1) & 
            (col("row_num") <= end_idx)
        ).drop("row_num")
        
        chunk_records = chunk_df.count()
        chunk_output_path = f"{output_path}/sanitized_chunk_{i+1:03d}_{timestamp}"
        
        logger.info(f"Exporting chunk {i+1}/{num_chunks}: {chunk_records:,} records")
        
        try:
            # Write chunk as CSV with PostgreSQL-compatible options
            chunk_df.coalesce(1).write \
                .option("header", "true") \
                .option("nullValue", "") \
                .option("emptyValue", "") \
                .option("quote", '"') \
                .option("escape", '"') \
                .option("quoteAll", "false") \
                .mode("overwrite") \
                .csv(chunk_output_path)
            
            logger.info(f"‚úÖ Chunk {i+1} exported successfully")
            
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"‚ùå Failed to export chunk {i+1}: {str(e)}")
            continue
    
    logger.info(f"‚úÖ Export complete! {num_chunks} chunks saved to: {output_path}")
    return output_path

def main_sanitization_pipeline():
    """
    Main sanitization pipeline function
    """
    logger.info("üöÄ Starting Synapse PySpark Data Sanitization Pipeline")
    
    try:
        # Step 1: Read from Delta Lake
        logger.info(f"Step 1: Reading from Delta Lake: {INPUT_DELTA_PATH}")
        
        if not mssparkutils.fs.exists(INPUT_DELTA_PATH):
            logger.error(f"‚ùå Input Delta table not found: {INPUT_DELTA_PATH}")
            return None
        
        df = spark.read.format("delta").load(INPUT_DELTA_PATH)
        initial_count = df.count()
        logger.info(f"‚úÖ Loaded {initial_count:,} records from Delta table")
        
        if initial_count == 0:
            logger.error("‚ùå No data found in Delta table")
            return None
        
        # Step 2: Apply data cleaning and sanitization
        logger.info("Step 2: Applying data cleaning and sanitization")
        
        # Clean text fields
        df = careful_clean_text_fields(df)
        
        # Clean and convert DOB
        df = clean_and_convert_dob(df)
        
        # Clean register_lett and poll_number
        df = clean_register_lett_and_poll_number(df)
        
        # Truncate name fields
        df = truncate_name_fields(df)
        
        # Truncate address fields
        df = truncate_address_fields(df)
        
        # Handle address4 special cases
        df = clean_address4_special_cases(df)
        
        # Fix null address4 values
        df = fix_address4_null_values(df)
        
        # Clean hash_id and deduplicate
        df = clean_hash_id_and_deduplicate(df)
        
        # Add missing columns and reorder
        df = add_missing_columns_and_reorder(df)
        
        # Final validation
        df = final_data_validation(df)
        
        final_count = df.count()
        logger.info(f"‚úÖ Data sanitization complete: {final_count:,} records")
        logger.info(f"Records removed during sanitization: {initial_count - final_count:,}")
        
        # Step 3: Export to blob storage
        logger.info("Step 3: Exporting to blob storage")
        
        export_path = export_to_blob_storage(df, OUTPUT_BLOB_PATH)
        
        if export_path:
            logger.info("üéâ Sanitization pipeline completed successfully!")
            logger.info(f"üìÅ Data exported to: {export_path}")
            
            # Show sample of final data
            logger.info("üìã Sample of sanitized data:")
            sample_data = df.limit(3).select("lname", "fname", "address", "address4", "dob", "hash_id").collect()
            for i, row in enumerate(sample_data):
                logger.info(f"   Row {i+1}: {row.lname}, {row.fname}, {row.address4}, {row.dob}, {row.hash_id}")
            
            return df
        else:
            logger.error("‚ùå Export failed")
            return None
            
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"‚ùå Pipeline failed: {str(e)}")
        import traceback
        logger.error("Full traceback:")
        logger.error(traceback.format_exc())
        return None

def check_input_data():
    """
    Quick function to check input data availability
    """
    try:
        logger.info(f"Checking input data availability: {INPUT_DELTA_PATH}")
        
        if not mssparkutils.fs.exists(INPUT_DELTA_PATH):
            logger.error(f"‚ùå Input path does not exist: {INPUT_DELTA_PATH}")
            return False
        
        df = spark.read.format("delta").load(INPUT_DELTA_PATH)
        total_count = df.count()
        logger.info(f"‚úÖ Total records in Delta table: {total_count:,}")
        
        if total_count == 0:
            logger.warning("‚ö†Ô∏è Delta table exists but contains no records")
            return False
        
        # Check sample data structure
        logger.info("üìã Sample data columns:")
        for col_name in df.columns[:10]:
            logger.info(f"   - {col_name}")
        
        if len(df.columns) > 10:
            logger.info(f"   ... and {len(df.columns) - 10} more columns")
        
        # Check for critical columns
        critical_cols = ['hash_id', 'lname', 'fname', 'address']
        missing_cols = [col for col in critical_cols if col not in df.columns]
        if missing_cols:
            logger.error(f"‚ùå Missing critical columns: {missing_cols}")
            return False
        
        return True
        
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"‚ùå Error checking input data: {str(e)}")
        return False

# Execute the pipeline
if __name__ == "__main__":
    logger.info("üöÄ Starting Synapse PySpark Sanitization Pipeline")
    
    # Check input data first
    logger.info("Step 1: Checking input data availability...")
    if check_input_data():
        logger.info("‚úÖ Input data check passed")
        
        # Run the sanitization pipeline
        logger.info("Step 2: Running sanitization pipeline...")
        result_df = main_sanitization_pipeline()
        
        if result_df is not None:
            logger.info("üéâ Sanitization pipeline completed successfully")
        else:
            logger.error("‚ùå Sanitization pipeline failed")
    else:
        logger.error("‚ùå Input data check failed - cannot proceed")
